list_definition.definition: the words written in large letters at the top of newspaper articles

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I never read a paper in detail – I just glance at the headlines.

list_ex_of_english: This decision is based on the assumption that a keyword in a headline or leader indicates special commitment to the issue.
Like a newspaper, each story has a headline with a location and date leading the story.
In fact, as the text below the headline reveals, this shows a divergence of trends.
This means that there has to be a headline number, or very limited set of numbers, against which success or failure will be judged.
There is also, however, amongst the plethora of images and interviews, evidence of linguistic compression, especially in headlines.
One reason for such disagreements may be because different types of headline have sometimes been lumped together.
Many newspapers and periodicals regularly incorporate phrasal verbs into their headlines.
The writer claims to have ' 'entered the narrative' ' by virtue of a pair of mated headlines, top of the page, same typeface, same type size.
